text: Refrigerated 375 ml clear bottle corked poured into a white wine glass. Clear Amber with very little off-white head, no carbonation, medium/thick body, and very little lacing. Taste is rich semi-sweet apples and honey. Very nice cider.

Really nice dessert cider. Deep focused sweetness, very juicy, rich. Maybe a hint of cinnamon but mostly a nice pure concentrated apple goodness. Maybe it doesnt have the intensity and depth of an ice cider, but its good enough as it is, esp for dessert, and a great price point.

Bouteille 375ml. Couleur dorée pâle translucide, très léger film sur les parois du verre ainsi quà la surface. Arôme de
pomme cuite, pelure de pomme, alcool, soupçon dérable, un petit quelque chose de "off". Goût de jus de pomme, côté un peu chimique, légère acidité, sucré moyen. corps moyen.
Tastes like sweet uncarbonated cider. Just thicker like a mead. Would be good over ice or mixed in with something
Oh my that is lovely. Melon, apricots, subtle honey. The aroma is wonderful, expressing lots of gentle fruit. This is perfect for an after dinner beverage.

Sample.
Pours blond with no legs. Aroma is of apples, sugar, fruits. Taste is of apples, pears, sugar, very slight acidity. Palate: Medium-full bodied. No carbonation. Overall: Surprisingly refreshing. Quite nice. Enjoyable. My kind of drink.

[7069-20150215] Bottle. Mild wooden crate of apples aroma. Clear, bright gold body with no head. Woody apple flavour has a sweet syrup base. Medium body. Tasty. (8/3/8/4/17) 4.0
(Mondial des Cidres @ Complexe Desjardins, Montreal, QC)

Sample. Clear gold pour. Aroma is fruity, tons of apple, applesauce, light boozy notes,caramel. Taste is sweet, desserty, some sort of waxy flavor, quite sweet, some caramel. Palate is med bodied, light for an ice cider. Good, but far from the complexity you normally get from such a cider.
Poured from a bottle on the RBSG2015 bus. Big apple notes, sweet apple cider, spice, cinnamon, fresh pressed apple juice. Very tasty.

Bottle, shared on the bus at RBSG. I guess this is akin to a late harvest vintage in the wine world? Not as sweet or heavy or potent as an ice cider, but sharing some of the typical character traits of sweet vanilla cookie, baked apple, hints of spice. A bit buttery (in a good way), with a tartness in the finish that lends to drinkability. Very nice and complex for a sweet cider, without the cloying corn syrup sweetness that usually kills sweet ciders for me. Excellent.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: sample. clear bright gold, orange tint, surprising legs for its relatively low alcohol content. sweet natural apple juice, orchard fruitiness, touch of acidity - granny smith-like, lightly astringent apple skin, baked apples, cherries - toasted almonds, cinnamon, ginger. flat carbonation, medium body - syrupy; sweet but never cloying fruity-chalky and lightly astringent finish. in-between an ice cider and a sweet normand cider.

Bottle on the RBSG party bus, thanks Doug 
Clear golden with a small white head, no lacing. Aroma of apples. Taste of apple and cinnamon 
Good

Dorée pâle. Belle figure. Au nez, gentillesse fruitée (pommes et autres fruits), miel débordant, acidité. Au goût, des pommes et des autres fruits dans un sirop assez sucré. Bouche collante. Finale très douce et sirupeuse. Dans le domaine du dessert. Pas si mal. Simple. Difficilement haïssable.

Bottle at Cajun Cafe Cider and Mead Fest 2015. Pours the color of apple juice with no head. Aroma is massive apple, sweetness, and some sweet almond. Flavor is similar with massive apple, some sweetness, and some almond flavors. A very nice cider overall.
Nice sexy little bottle thanks to Doug. Pours out a honey color no head. Nose is great sweet honey and lots of apple. Taste is more of the sweetness and apples very tasty.
Bottle on RBSG bus. Pours a clear gold with small white head. The aroma is honey and apple skin. Thin mouth, strong apple skin, honey, light booze, very good.
Bottle. Pours a clear copper color with a medium white head. A wonderful fruity nose. Huge sweet apple, sugary, smooth. Awesome. Massive essence of apple.

2 oz sample from bottle (375 ml). 

Appearance: Clear pale yellow golden with not much legs. 

Aroma: The description is quite accurate, theres some nice melon features along apricots, honey and mild spiciness but surprisingly not much apples. 

Taste: Not very sweet with again some nice melon features, apricots, honeyed notes, mild acidic presence and a bit of apples.

Palate: Medium body. Borderline syrupy, but not nearly as thick as ice cider even though it has a similar profile. Rather dull finish. 

Overall: Interesting product. It tasted light a light version of an ice cider. The melon presence is original and really enjoyable. Tasty and fresh.
Pours a clear deep 24 carat gold with no head. Aroma is fermented apples with some faint barnyard. Taste is Golden Delicious apples & honey. Very smooth and pleasant ice cider.
Bottle. Pours clear golden amber. Aroma is sweet apples acidy apple pie. Flavor is acidy apples sour sweet. Really nice, easy drinking.

2015-02-15. Dark yellow body, headless. Aroma is a bit strange with an almost spice like muskiness that is unexpected. Flavour is quite sweet, with an interesting fruit character in the finish that doesnt scream apples per se but is pleasant. Light acidity. 7+ Smooth medium bodied palate, no carbonation. Decent and enjoyable, but a tad simple. Bottle at Mondial des Cidres, Montreal.

Bottle from Brusin Ales - pours clear honey, still. Big smokey Apple flavor, very, very syrupy sweet. It reminds me of major market Apple juice. Im not getting any yeast characteristics other than bubblegum, but thats a stretch. Too sweet for me.

Purchased from Learys, the Amesbury location, Saturday afternoon. $9.99 for the gorgeously slender 375 mL bottle. To long-stemmed white wine glass, it pours a rich burnt orange. Honey orange, some may say. Viscid; my first thought was accurate. Served lightly chilled. Aromas of cherry blossom honey, holiday blend cider, agave syrup, DAnjou pear purée, flora grapes, and unripe plantains. Tastes the same with the addition of dried apricots, apple juice, and hay. Breathtakingly fruity. A lot going on in this ice cider. Viscous upon consumption; sweet notes spring forth under a hidden march of shining booze warmth. Seriously likeable.

Bottle. Pours a very dark gold -- whisky colored -- with tiny bubbles clustering on the sides of the glass. Nose is apples, apple skin, almonds, cane syrup, and a touch of lime. Very sweet and malic on the tongue, but with a bitter thread running through it that cuts the glycerine sweetness nicely; its a seed and skin bitterness thats harmonious rather than clashing. Mouthfeel is very rich but not overly so. Finish is warm, turning a touch acidic. Really enjoyable.

Tasting at MattsThe color is red-copper. Aroma of apple crumble pie, sweet, caramelly. Sweet apple juice, with light acidity and light astringency.Not the most complex one, lacking some alcohol punch, but fairly pleasant.

808s n FartRates review #29 courtesy of kbudd19
Pours still with a nice golden color. 

The aroma is sweet, with a bunch of concentrated apple character, some honey, and a bit of floral perfume.

The flavor is very apple forward, again with the very concentrated & sweet apple character. Although it does have some nice tartness and light acidity, There is also a sort of mead like honey character to it as well. 

Delicious and rich, just like an Ice Cider ought to be.

Bottle, pours a clear golden orange with no head. Nose brings out apple butterscotch, not much else. Flavour is very smooth, with loads of apple butterscotch upfront, with caramelized sugar in back, and a touch of molasses. It sort of burns a bit, despite only being 6.9% -- just like a typical ice cider. A lovely surprise. Not exceedingly complex, but still very nice.

Bottle @ Presidential Suite. Thanks, Kevin. Clear caramel colored pour. Sweet baked apple pie, caramel sauce, and brown sugar. Mild pear and honey. Nice hint of acidity and lemon zest. Flavor has the typical sweetness of brown sugar and apple pie. Mild spice and acidity. Some pear and crust/dough. Slight vanilla. Nice stuff.
Bottle shared by Victor. Weekly tasting. Pours amber. Nose/taste of frozen apple, maple syrup, brown sugar. Medium body.
Bottle. A golden pour with no head. Sweet apple aromas. Apple sweetness, no real maple or tartness.
375ml bottle. Clear copper body, no head. Aroma of apples, honey, crème brûlée, vanilla beans, vinegar, autumn leaves. Taste of gala apples, apple vinegar, honey, crème brûlée. Light and good.

Bottle shared by kbudd19 up in the hotel post-grand tasting, RBSG. Thanks, Kevin! Pours a clearorange-gold with some bubbles. Nice apple cider aroma, with honey, some malts and earthy notes. The flavor is an intense apple - sweet, slightly tart, and somewhat spicy. Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a sweet mouthfeel. Really nice.

Offering shared at RateBeer Grand Tasting 2014 (St. Louis, MO). Pours a gentle golden hue, faint haze, with frothy whitish ring, mellow lacing. Aromas are a bit of apple, touch cidery with some gentle honeycrisp, some faint smoke and earth. Initial is medium bodied, a bit sweet and cidery, gentle honey. Middle is a touch sweet, cidery, mellow yeast with some gentle apple sauce sweetness. Backend is a bit cidery, spicy with some
Gentle sweetness, apple and gentle cider. A bit fruity, a bit more dry with touches of sweetness. Nice. Not as deep as expected but pretty flavorful and tasty.
Weird ice cidre bottle. Clearish pour, jsut sweet apples all the way, just mindblowingly sweet.
Bottle. Clear liquid golden pour, no head. Aroma, sweet apples, light sweetness. Taste, very sweet, tart apples, thick mouthfeel, sweet decadent finish. Excellent.
Bottle - Mellow green apple and sugar. Clear gold non carbonated. Syrupy sweet apple. Nice and rich, little goes a long way.

Clear gold with no carbonation. Rich concentrated aroma and flavor. Apple peach nectarines honey floral. Very sweet and definitely desert oriented but wow does this taste good. Thick syrupy mouth feel but not sticky. This makes me want to try more iced ciders.

Bottle courtesy of Paul at a small tasting with Max, Paul, and Andy.  Pours a clear gold and treacle color. Lots of apples, sugar and sweet apple, a faint bit of skins and tannins.  Sugary sweet apple.  Quite nice for such a low ABV.  Sweet on the finish, candied apple.

Bottle shared by Paul, only $8/375ml. 7% alcohol is exceptionally low, but the flavor profile doesnt show that. Though it is a bit thinner than traditional ice cider, the sweetness and acidity are still there. Bright, spritzy, sweet nose, very easily drinking, I like the low alcohol on this, it actually works very wellan ice cider that can actually be drank at a normal rate.
